name: Plank Shoulder Taps
how_to_perform:
1. Begin in a high plank position with your hands placed shoulder-width apart on the ground and your body forming a straight line from your head to your heels.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips do not sag or pike upwards throughout the movement.
3. Place your right hand in front of your left hand.
4. Lift your shoulders up slightly as if you're pointing them toward the ceiling, and simultaneously tap your right hand on your left shoulder with a small, controlled motion.
5. Immediately return to the starting position with your hands back in their original placement.
6. Repeat on the other side by alternating which hand is tapping on the opposite shoulder.
short_summary: Plank shoulder taps are an abdominal exercise that involves engaging the core while performing shoulder movements from a high plank position.
alternative_names: Shoulder Taps while in Plank Position
